query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
1 Mentr’ io dubbiava per lo viso spento, 2 de la fulgida fiamma che lo spense 3 uscì un spiro che mi fece attento,
query.error: **English:** 1 While I was hesitating, with my sight extinguished, 2 from the radiant flame that extinguished it 3 came a breath that made me attentive,
query.result: 1 Þa ic ðeah wæs on ðam dimman wudu, 2 of ðære beorhtan leoman ðe ðær bærnde, 3 com ðær an stefn ðe me spræc to,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
4 dicendo: «Intanto che tu ti risense 5 de la vista che haï in me consunta, 6 ben è che ragionando la compense.
query.error: **English:** 4 saying: "While you are recovering 5 from the sight that you have lost in me, 6 it is good that you compensate for it by reasoning.
query.result: 4 cwæð: "Þenden ðu ðine gesihðe hæfst, 5 ðe ðu on me forlure, 6 ðonne is riht ðæt ðu ðæt mid ðinum ræde gebete.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
7 Comincia dunque; e dì ove s’appunta 8 l’anima tua, e fa ragion che sia 9 la vista in te smarrita e non defunta:
query.error: **English:** 7 Begin then; and tell where your soul is fixed, 8 and suppose that your sight is lost in you and not extinguished: 9 for the lady who leads you through this divine
query.result: 7 Ongin ðu nu ða; and sege hwær ðin sawul bið gefæst, 8 and wena ðæt ðin gesiho bið on ðe forloren and na forworden: 9 forðæm ðe ðæt wif ðe ðe ðurh ðas godcundan

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
10 perché la donna che per questa dia 11 regïon ti conduce, ha ne lo sguardo 12 la virtù ch’ebbe la man d’Anania».
query.result:
**English:**
10 because the lady who leads you through this divine 11 region has in her gaze 12 the power that the hand of Ananias had.
**Old English:**
10 for ðæm ðe seo wif ðe ðe ðurh ðas godcundan 11 rice gebringð, hæfð on ðæm gesyhðe 12 ða mihte ðe ða hand Ananie hæfde.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
13 Io dissi: «Al suo piacere e tosto e tardo 14 vegna remedio a li occhi, che fuor porte 15 quand’ ella entrò col foco ond’ io sempr’ ardo.
query.error: **English:** 13 I said: "At his pleasure, soon or late, 14 let remedy come to the eyes that were blinded 15 when she entered with the fire with which I always burn.
query.result: 13 Ic cwæð: "Æt his willan, hraðe oððe læte, 14 cume ræd to ðam eagum ðe wæron ær forlorene, 15 ða ðe heo in eode mid ðam fyre ðe ic symle byrne."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
16 Lo ben che fa contenta questa corte, 17 Alfa e O è di quanta scrittura 18 mi legge Amore o lievemente o forte».
query.error: **English:** 16 The good that makes this court content, 17 Alpha and Omega is of every scripture 18 that Love reads to me, softly or forcefully.
query.result: 16 Þæt god ðæt ðisne hired gefylleð, 17 Alpha and O is æghwylcre gewritenes 18 ðe me Lufe ræt, ðe softe oððe ðe strange.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
19 Quella medesma voce che paura 20 tolta m’avea del sùbito abbarbaglio, 21 di ragionare ancor mi mise in cura;
query.error: **English:** 19 That same voice which had taken away my fear 20 caused by the sudden dazzling light, 21 made me eager to speak again;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
22 e disse: «Certo a più angusto vaglio 23 ti conviene schiarar: dicer convienti 24 chi drizzò l’arco tuo a tal berzaglio».
query.error: **English:** 22 and it said: "Certainly you must sift more narrowly: 23 you must tell who directed your arrow to such a target."
query.result: 22 and cwæð: "Þe is nu ðearf ðæt ðu ðe georne 23 on ðinum mode gemæðe hwæt ðu ðonne mæge 24 ðurh ðone ðinre agenre strengðe."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
25 E io: «Per filosofici argomenti 26 e per autorità che quinci scende 27 cotale amor convien che in me si ’mprenti:
query.error: **English:** 25 And I: "Through philosophical arguments 26 and through authority that descends from here, 27 such love must be imprinted in me:
query.result: 25 And ic: "Þurh wisdomes wordum 26 and þurh anweald þe of heonon cymð, 27 swylc lufu gebyreð ðæt heo on me gewurðe:

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
28 ché ’l bene, in quanto ben, come s’intende, 29 così accende amore, e tanto maggio 30 quanto più di bontate in sé comprende.
query.error: **English:** 28 because the good, insofar as it is understood as good, 29 thus kindles love, and all the more 30 the more goodness it comprises in itself.
query.result: 28 forðæm ðe ðæt gode, swa swa hit god is, swa hit man ongiteð, 29 swa hit lufe onæleð, and swa mycel mare 30 swa hit mare godnesse on him selfum hæfð.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
31 Dunque a l’essenza ov’ è tanto avvantaggio, 32 che ciascun ben che fuor di lei si trova 33 altro non è ch’un lume di suo raggio,
query.error: **English:** 31 Therefore, the essence in which there is so much advantage, 32 that every good which is found outside of it 33 is nothing but a ray of its light,
query.result: 31 Forðæm ðære andwlætan ðe ðær is swilce micel gesælð, 32 ðæt ælc gōd ðæt būtan hire is funden 33 nis nāht elles būton lēoht hire beorhto.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
34 più che in altra convien che si mova 35 la mente, amando, di ciascun che cerne 36 il vero in che si fonda questa prova.
query.error: **English:** 34 more than in any other thing, the mind of each person who discerns 35 the truth on which this proof is founded 36 must move, loving.
query.result: 34 Māre ðonne on ōðerre ðing ðæt mód sceal 35 ðæs monnes ðe ðone sōð gesēoð 36 on ðære grundfeste ðe ðeos cūðnes on stent.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
37 Tal vero a l’intelletto mïo sterne 38 colui che mi dimostra il primo amore 39 di tutte le sustanze sempiterne.
query.error: **English:** 37 Such truth to my intellect my stars reveal, 38 he who shows me the first love 39 of all eternal substances.
query.result: 37 Swylc soðfæstnes mîn mód geseah 38 se ðe me ærest lufe lærde 39 ealra gesceafta ðara ðe sind.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
40 Sternel la voce del verace autore, 41 che dice a Moïsè, di sé parlando: 42 ‘Io ti farò vedere ogne valore’.
query.error: **English:** 40 The voice of the true Author is silent, 41 who says to Moses, speaking of himself: 42 ‘I will show you every value’.
query.result: 40 ðæs soðfæstan Freond ða ða geswac, 41 se ðe Moyses ðus to him sprecende: 42 ‘Ic ðe ætiewan wille ælce mærðe’.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
43 Sternilmi tu ancora, incominciando 44 l’alto preconio che grida l’arcano 45 di qui là giù sovra ogne altro bando».
query.error: **English:** 43 Spread out before me again, beginning 44 the lofty sermon that proclaims the mystery 45 from here below to every other edict».
query.result: 43 Astrecemeðu eft, onginnende 44 ðone heanlican bodscipe ðe bodað ðæt digle 45 of ðissum life ofer ealra ðinga gebann».

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.

query.result: 46 And ic gehyrde: "Þurh monnes geþoht 47 and þurh anweald him geþafiende 48 ðinra lufa to Gode lociað ðone hehstan.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
49 Ma dì ancor se tu senti altre corde 50 tirarti verso lui, sì che tu suone 51 con quanti denti questo amor ti morde».

88 fec’ io in tanto in quant’ ella diceva, 89 stupendo, e poi mi rifece sicuro 90 un disio di parlare ond’ ïo ardeva.

94 divoto quanto posso a te supplìco 95 perché mi parli: tu vedi mia voglia, 96 e per udirti tosto non la dico».

Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.

100 e similmente l’anima primaia 101 mi facea trasparer per la coverta 102 quant’ ella a compiacermi venìa gaia.

query.prompt:

112 e quanto fu diletto a li occhi miei, 113 e la propria cagion del gran disdegno, 114 e l’idïoma ch’usai e che fei.

query.result: 112 and hu mycel wæs ðara minra eagna wynn, 113 and ðæs miclan graman selfes gefylsta, 114 and ðæt geþeóde ðe ic brúcode and ðe ic worhte.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
115 Or, figluol mio, non il gustar del legno 116 fu per sé la cagion di tanto essilio, 117 ma solamente il trapassar del segno.

query.result: 115 Nu, min sunu, nis ðæs wæstmes wlite 116 ðurh hine sylfne ðæs wræclastes, 117 ac ðurh ðæs mæðels ofermæðe.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
118 Quindi onde mosse tua donna Virgilio, 119 quattromilia trecento e due volumi 120 di sol desiderai questo concilio;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
121 e vidi lui tornare a tutt’ i lumi 122 de la sua strada novecento trenta 123 fïate, mentre ch’ïo in terra fu’mi.

query.result: 121 and ic hine geseah eft cyrran to eallum leohtum 122 his weges nigon hund nigontig 123 siðas, ða hwile ðe ic on eorðan wæs.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
124 La lingua ch’io parlai fu tutta spenta 125 innanzi che a l’ovra inconsummabile 126 fosse la gente di Nembròt attenta:

query.result: 124 Se ðæt geðeode ðe ic spræc wæs eal forloren 125 ærðæm ðe ðæt unfullfremed weorc 126 ðara Nembroða leoda wære gefylled:

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
127 ché nullo effetto mai razïonabile, 128 per lo piacere uman che rinovella 129 seguendo il cielo, sempre fu durabile.
query.error: **English:** 127 for no rational effect, 128 because of the human pleasure that is renewed 129 by following the heavens, was ever lasting.
query.result: 127 forðæm ðe nænig ðæs geðohtes wyrcung, 128 ðurh ðæs mannes willan ðe bið niwe, 129 ðurh ðæs heofones folgung, næfre ðurhwunode.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
130 Opera naturale è ch’uom favella; 131 ma così o così, natura lascia 132 poi fare a voi secondo che v’abbella.

142 come ’l sol muta quadra, l’ora sesta».
